sentence.Network_en: Such remarks , though, hardly begin to explain that prodigiously gifted author Henry James.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而这样的说法, 一点也不能解释这个得天独厚的作家亨利·詹姆斯的情况.

sentence.Network_en: The prices of farms rose prodigiously.

entry.tran: 巨大的；庞大的；大得惊人的
entry.def: Something that is prodigious is very large or impressive.

example.ex: This business generates cash in prodigious amounts...
He impressed all who met him with his prodigious memory.
example.tran: 他惊人的记忆力让所有见过他的人都印象深刻。

auth_sentence.content: It litigates, prodigiously, but uses outside counsel.
auth_sentence.res_content: It litigates, prodigiously, but uses outside counsel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It litigates, prodigiously, but uses outside counsel.

auth_sentence.content: He still travels grandly and eats prodigiously.
auth_sentence.res_content: He still travels grandly and eats prodigiously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He still travels grandly and eats prodigiously.

auth_sentence.content: But perhaps her motive, hidden in plain sight, is prodigiously ordinary: to hold the interest of a man.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But perhaps her motive, hidden in plain sight, is prodigiously ordinary: to hold the interest of a man.
